Detailed Description

A basic but full-featured implementation of PacketFactory.

Typical implementations will look like: 

    class MyPacketFactory : public AbstractPacketFactory {
      public: MyPacketFactory () : AbstractPacketFactory() { }
      public: MyPacketFactory (PacketFactory parent) : AbstractPacketFactory(parent) { }
      protected: virtual BasicVRTPacket *getPacket (PacketType type, int64_t id,
                                                    const BasicVRTPacket *p) const {
        ...
        return AbstractPacketFactory::getPacket(clazz, type, id, p, copy);
      }
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

vrt::AbstractPacketFactory::AbstractPacketFactory ( const AbstractPacketFactory *  pf  ) 

Basic copy constructor for the class.

vrt::AbstractPacketFactory::AbstractPacketFactory (  ) 

Creates a new instance that can be written to.

Initially this will just be a simple data packet with no fields set (other than the required packet length of 4).

Member Function Documentation

virtual BasicVRTPacket* vrt::AbstractPacketFactory::getPacket ( PacketType  type,
int64_t  id,
const BasicVRTPacket *  p 
) const [protected, virtual]

Initializes a packet.

This is a utility method called by both getPacket(BasicVRTPacket,bool) and getPacket(PacketType,int64_t).

Parameters:
type The packet type (VRT allows one Data/ExtData and one Context/ExtContext per class).
id The class ID of the packet.
p The packet to initialize with (null if n/a).
Returns:
The packet or null if n/a.

Reimplemented in vrt::PacketFactory.

BasicVRTPacket* vrt::AbstractPacketFactory::getPacket ( PacketType  type,
int64_t  id 
) const [inline]

Gets a specific packet from the factory when given a generic packet.

Parameters:
type The packet type (VRT allows one Data/ExtData and one Context/ExtContext per class).
id The class ID of the packet.
Returns:
The applicable packet. This will return null if not supported.
Exceptions:
VRTException If initialization of the given type is supported, but data and/or id do not match it.

References getPacket().

BasicVRTPacket* vrt::AbstractPacketFactory::getPacket ( const BasicVRTPacket *  p  )  const [inline]

Gets a specific packet from the factory when given a generic packet.

Parameters:
p The existing (generic) packet.
Returns:
The applicable packet. This will return null if not supported.
Exceptions:
VRTException If p is null.
VRTException If initialization of the given type is supported, but the packet given does not match it.

Referenced by getPacket().
